text: Social Psychology Basics « Social psychology: a branch of psychology that studies how we think and behave in social situations o Social cognition: investigates the ways in which we think (cognition) about ourselves and others = Attitudes (evaluative beliefs we hold about things in our world; Cognitive Dissonance Theory) » Attributions (trying to explain the cause of a behavior; Fundamental attribution error; actor/observer bias; self-serving bias) s Prejudice o Social influence: social pressures that serve to modify our thoughts and/or behavior » Persuasion (trying to change attitudes) = Conformity (behaving in accordance with group norms) » Compliance (yielding to a request) s Obedience (yielding to a demand) m Bystander Effect
